3.1_cas_01.content: The ancient greeks have a famous story about a queen named Cassiopeia.

3.1_cas_02.content: Cassiopeia always used to brag how she was more beautiful than everyone else!

3.1_cas_03.content: The sea god Poseidon thought she was being rude. So he decided to teach her a lesson.

3.1_cas_04.content: Poseidon made Cassiopeia a constellation in the night sky,
And placed her upside-down on her throne to embarrass her!

3.1_umi_02.content: One day, while out in the woods,
that it was actually his mother who was under a spell!

3.1_umi_03.content: Arcas was about to catch the great bear,
but the Greek God Zeus stopped him just in time
and turned Arcas into a little bear
so he could be with his Mom.

3.1_umi_04.content: Zeus placed the two bears into the sky
to keep them safe and protected.
Arcas is known as Ursa Minor, the Little Bear.

3.1_leo_01.content: In Greek myths, Leo the Lion
lived outside an ancient city called Nemea.

3.1_leo_02.content: For many years Leo would scoop up people
from Nemea and no one could stop him!

3.1_leo_03.content: One day, Hercules went to stop the lion...

3.1_tau_01.content: The ancient Greeks tell the story
of a wild bull named Taurus,

3.1_tau_02.content: One day, he trampled a field of wild flowers
and Persephone, the Goddess of Spring,
and they soon became good friends!

3.1_tau_03.content: From then on, every spring Persephone
would ride on Taurus' back, and the two
of them would make the flowers bloom

about a famous wrestling contest between

It began when Orion bragged he
was so strong, he could defeat
any living creature, no matter how big or strong!

3.1_sco_03.content: and sent Scorpius to stop him.
Scorpius beat Orion in an epic wrestling match!

than all the other animals on the planet.

3.1_ori_04.content: Their wrestling match was so epic

TaurusTO.content: The best time to see Taurus is in the winter
when he can be seen high in the sky at night.

CassiopeiaTO.content: The Cassiopeia constellation looks like the letter "W"
depending on what time of year you're looking at the night sky.

CygnusTO.content: The constellation Cygnus contains the star Deneb,
one of the brightest stars in our sky!
Can you find Deneb in the picture?
When it gets dark outside, look up at the sky,

LeoTO.content: Leo is one of the easiest constellations to find.
Look for a backwards question mark -
that's the head and chest. Then move to the left
to find a triangle and the lion’s backside.
Can you see Leo in the night sky?

OrionTO.content: The three bright stars in the middle of
Orion's constellation are known as "Orion's belt".
They are the easiest constellation to spot in the night sky.
Can you find Orion's belt in the night sky?

ScorpiusTO.content: Antares, the brightest star in the constellation,
is the "heart" of the scorpion. Can you see it?
Sometimes people confuse this star with Mars,
because they are both colored red-orange!

UrsaMajorTO.content: Next time you're out looking at the stars,
see if you can find Ursa Major,

UrsaMinorTO.content: The star at the end of Ursa Minor's tail is called
The North Star helps people figure out which way is North!
Can you find the North Star?
